alert.note: Alert for Uintah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 1:12PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Green River near Jensen affecting Uintah County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Green River near Jensen. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, minor lowland flooding is expected along the Green River, impacting agricultural land, irrigation and a few out buildings near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM MDT Monday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain above bankfull conditions. Expect water levels to rise Tuesday night, with a maximum value of 9.9 feet, or about 20,800 cfs Friday afternoon. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.8 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
